title: Add Privacy Policy page and footer link for Rankawat Web Solutions

requirements.summary: Add a new /privacy-policy page that renders the Rankawat Web Solutions Privacy Policy in English with section headings and Last Updated date set to 05 Feb 2026.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /privacy-policy renders a Privacy Policy page.
The page includes the company name "Rankawat Web Solutions" and shows "Last Updated: 05 Feb 2026".

The page includes the 8 sections reflected in the user-provided policy (Information We Collect, How We Use Your Information, Data Security, Cookies Policy, Third-Party Services, User Rights, Changes to This Privacy Policy, Contact Us).
The page includes the provided contact details: Mobile: 76910 29526 and Email: rankawatwebsolutions09@gmail.com.
Content is presented in English (user-facing text on this page is English).

file_operations.description: Create a new PrivacyPolicyPage component that displays: page title "Privacy Policy", company name "Rankawat Web Solutions", "Last Updated: 05 Feb 2026", and 8 clearly separated English sections with headings (Information We Collect, How We Use Your Information, Data Security, Cookies Policy, Third-Party Services, User Rights, Changes to This Privacy Policy, Contact Us) including contact details Mobile: 76910 29526 and Email: rankawatwebsolutions09@gmail.com.
Register a new TanStack Router route for path "/privacy-policy" and wire it into the existing route tree so the new PrivacyPolicyPage is reachable via client-side navigation.

requirements.summary: Add a Privacy Policy link to the footer Quick Links that navigates to /privacy-policy via client-side routing.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer "Quick Links" includes a "Privacy Policy" link/button.
Clicking "Privacy Policy" navigates to /privacy-policy without a full page reload.

file_operations.description: Add a new "Privacy Policy" item to the footer translations quick links map (for both supported languages) using key "privacy-policy" so the existing useNavigate-based handleNavigation routes to "/privacy-policy" without a full page reload.
